title: Rules around toxicity
body:
They should be changed.
If I am toxic and only write one line of chat that was toxic, I will get the same chat restriction as someone who was toxic the whole game

If I intentionally feed one kill, I'll get the same punishment as someone who intentionally fed 50 kills.

That's the same logic as saying that someone who spelled cat "PXY" will be equally as wrong as someone who spelled cat "KAT"

I've never been banned for any of these things or restricted, but I just realized how unfair the system is because when my friends and I are playing I do like to int a few kills when they KS me and I am toxic towards them but they're ok with it.

I think you're looking at this wrong.

The policy Riot has is that toxicity and feeding are not acceptable in ANY quantity. Anything worse WOULD get you punished more (and can get you punished faster, as you can skip steps in punishment), but the "lowest" level is already deemed unacceptable, so all the punishments after that have the same effect since Riot can't issue a stricter one.

It's sort of like how your job can fire you for poor performance, or they can fire you for poor performance, stealing office supplies, and harassing other employees. You're just as fired in both situations, even though one is technically worse, because the poor performance ALONE was sufficient to earn the punishment.

Or, to use your example, let's say I spell both that way on a spelling test. CAT is worth 1 point. Whether I spell it KAT or PXY, I'm still losing a point for spelling it wrong, even though one of them is, yes, further from correct than the other. The problem is that the system was checking if I spelled it right, and they people running the test aren't interested in "acceptable amounts of wrongness."

That said, the system does allow the occasional slip-up, and truly toxic players ARE punished more severely sooner than players who are not AS toxic.
